name: Chicken Alfredo
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Season chicken breasts with salt and black pepper. In a large skillet, cook chicken until no longer pink in the center. Remove and slice into thin strips.
In the same skillet, melt butter and sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
Add heavy cream and grated Parmesan cheese to the skillet. Stir until the sauce thickens.
Return sliced chicken to the skillet and cook until heated through. Season with additional salt and black pepper if needed.
Serve the chicken Alfredo sauce over cooked fettuccine pasta. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley.

name: Guacamole
instructions: Mash avocados in a bowl.
Chop onion, tomatoes, and cilantro.
Mix all ingredients with lime juice and salt.
Serve with tortilla chips.

name: Bruschetta
instructions: Toast the Italian bread slices.
Rub each slice with garlic cloves.
Top with chopped tomatoes and fresh basil.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt.

name: Spring Rolls
instructions: Soak rice paper in warm water until soft.
Place lettuce, shrimp, rice noodles, and mint leaves on rice paper.
Roll it up and serve with peanut sauce.

name: Caprese Salad
instructions: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella cheese.
Layer with fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Season with salt.

name: Sushi
instructions: Cook sushi rice and prepare ingredients.
Roll sushi with nori seaweed, rice, fish, and avocado.
Serve with wasabi and soy sauce.

name: Escargot
instructions: Bake snails with garlic butter and white wine.
Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

name: Beef Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a pan and stir-fry beef strips until browned.
Add chopped bell pepper, onion, and garlic.
Season with soy sauce and cook until vegetables are tender.
Serve hot.

name: Lasagna
instructions: Cook lasagna noodles and brown ground beef.
In a baking dish, layer noodles, ricotta cheese, ground beef, and mozzarella cheese.
Repeat layers and top with tomato sauce and Italian seasoning.
Bake until cheese is bubbly and golden.

name: Salmon
instructions: Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
In a pan, melt butter and sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
Add lemon juice and fresh dill. Cook for a few minutes.
Pan-sear salmon fillets until cooked through.
Serve with lemon butter sauce.

name: Beef Wellington
instructions: Sear beef fillet until browned. Let it cool.
Spread Dijon mustard over beef fillet.
Wrap with prosciutto and mushrooms sautéed in butter.
Wrap in puff pastry and brush with egg wash.
Bake until golden brown.

name: Pasta Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain.
In a separate pan, cook the guanciale or pancetta until crispy. Remove from heat and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated Pecorino Romano cheese. Season with salt and black pepper.
Combine the cooked spaghetti, crispy guanciale or pancetta, and the egg mixture in a bowl. Toss to combine until creamy and coated.
Garnish with fresh chopped parsley and additional cheese if desired. Serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large bowl, sift together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add eggs, milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract. Beat until well combined.
Stir in boiling water until the batter is smooth. Pour into prepared pans.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow cakes to cool completely, then frost with chocolate frosting.

name: Apple Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a pie dish with pastry dough.
In a large bowl, mix sliced apples with granulated sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cornstarch.
Pour apple mixture into the pie crust. Dot with butter.
Cover with a second pie crust, seal the edges, and cut vents.
Bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
Let it cool before serving.

name: Tiramisu
instructions: In a heatproof bowl, whisk together egg yolks and granulated sugar. Place over a pot of simmering water and whisk until thickened.
Remove from heat and whisk in mascarpone cheese until smooth.
Dip ladyfingers in strong brewed coffee (add Marsala wine if desired) and layer in a serving dish.
Spread a layer of mascarpone mixture and repeat layers.
Chill for several hours, then dust with cocoa powder before serving.

name: Cheesecake
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Grease and line a springform pan with parchment paper.
Mix graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter. Press into the bottom of the pan.
In a large bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well with each addition. Mix in sour cream and flour.
Pour over crust and bake for 55 to 60 minutes or until the center is set.
Chill in the refrigerator before serving.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a small bowl, mix flour and baking soda; set aside.
In a large bowl, beat softened butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract until creamy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Gradually mix in the flour mixture.
Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 9 to 11 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks.
